Package sorcer.service

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Arg
    Any named input value in particular a free variable.
    AssociativeContext<T>  
    CompoundExertion  
    Conditional  
    ConditionalExertion  
    Configurable
    An top-level interface for any kinds of configuration of this object.
    Context<T>
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    Contexter<T>
    A service interface related to Context evaluation/invocation and accessing contexts of of context service providers.
    Deployment
    Attributes related to signature based deployment.
    Describable  
    DynamicAccessor
    The creational factory interface used by the Accessor facility.
    Evaluation<T>
    A functionality required by all evaluations in SORCER.
    Evaluator<T>
    A functionality required by all evaluators in SORCER.
    Exec  
    Executor
    An top-level common local interface for all service-to-service (S2S) providers in SORCER.
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Service.service(sorcer.service.Exertion, net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction), to a service provider Service.
    Getter<T>
    A getter is a generic agent that returns a value calculated in many different ways.
    Identifiable  
    Incrementor<T>  
    IndexedContext  
    Invocation<T>
    The Invocation interface defines context driven invocations on a service context containing its parameters (paths) and arguments (values).
    Link
    The Link interface allows path values of service contexts to be linked to other service contexts using instances implementing this interface.
    Mappable<T>
    Implicit Maps such that a path indicates internal structure of composition with the last inner component indicated by the path.
    Monitorable
    All providers that need to be monitored implement this interface.
    ParModeling  
    Perturbation<T>  
    Positioning  
    Revaluation
    If an Evaluation that is Revaluation isRevaluable then it returns the revaluated value, otherwise returns the evaluated value ( #getValue(Parameter...))
    Scopable  
    SecureIdentifiable  
    Service
    An top-level common interface for all service peers in SORCER.
    Setter  
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    SpaceContext  
    Strategy  
    Tasker
    A Tasker is a service coordinating execution of all methods as specified by signatures associated with the instance of service Task and control flow exertion of task type.
    Updatable
    An top-level interface for any kinds of updates by this object.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Accessor
    A service accessing facility that allows to find dynamically a network service provider matching its Signature.
    ArgList  
    ArgSet  
    Block  
    Condition
    A Condition specifies a conditional value in a given service context for its free variables in the form of path/value pairs with paths being guards's parameters.
    Configurator  
    Context.none
    An object to specify no context value.
    ExertionCallable  
    ExertionExecutor  
    ExertionInfo  
    FidelityInfo  
    Identity
    Abstract Java class Identity
    Job
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    RemoteServiceEvent
    Wrapper around RemoteEvent to allow user defined event objects.
    RequestId
    Encapsulates a request id for an invoked exertion.
    ServiceExertion  
    ServiceFidelity  
    Signature.ReturnPath<T>  
    Task
    A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    TaskFactory
    Methods extracted from socer.eo.operator
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Context.Type  
    Deployment.Type
    There are three types of provisioning: per signature (SELF), for a collection of signatures as a federation (all signatures in exertion with Type.FED), and no provisioning (suspended provisioning) for a signature (NONE)
    Deployment.Unique
    A service can be deployed with uniqueness.
    Exec.State
    A State can be associated with the ExecState and other attributes of executing exertions (see sorcer.core.provider.exertmonitor.ExertMonitor)
    Signature.Direction  
    Signature.Kind  
    Signature.Type
    There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PRE (preprocess), SRV (process/service) , POST (postprocess), and APD_DATA (append data) and code>APD_CONTROL (append control strategy).
    Strategy.Access
    When the access type of a control context is set to PULL then the associated exertion is passed onto a Spacer, otherwise (access type is PUSH) the exertion is passed directly on to the provider specified by the SRVsignature.
    Strategy.Flow
    There are three flow types of FlowTypes that can be associated with exertions control context.
    Strategy.Monitor
    The CONCURRENT flow is controlled by mutex state WAIT, NOTIFY, and NOTIFY_ALL of the control context.
    Strategy.Opti  
    Strategy.Provision
    Indicates if on-demand provisioning is used for not existing currently service but required in the overlay network of service providers..
    Strategy.Wait
    Indicates whether the service requestor waits for results or not.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ArgException  
    ConfigurationException  
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
    EvaluationException  
    ExertionException
    The ExertionException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process it correctly.
    GetterException  
    InvocationException  
    MonitorException  
    NoneException
    The NoneException represents an exception that is thrown if a Context value is Context.none (undefined or null).
    ServiceException  
    SetterException  
    SignatureException  
    UnknownExertionException
    Any interaction with the MonitorSessionManager might result in this exception due to the following reasons: The session does not exist, Some operations on this session which was not valid.
    VarException
